action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: I am starting with a common five-letter English word that has a good balance of vowels and consonants.
guess: house

attempts = 1
target_word = month
guess = house
guess_feedback = h<yellow> o<green> u<red> s<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: h<yellow> o<green> u<red> s<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since "h" is yellow, it is in the word but not in the correct position. "o" is green, so it is in the correct position. I will try to build on this by keeping "o" and experimenting with other letters.
guess: boast

attempts = 2
target_word = month
guess = boast
guess_feedback = b<red> o<green> a<red> s<red> t<yellow>

guess_feedback: b<red> o<green> a<red> s<red> t<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: I will keep "o" in the same position and try to find a new combination. Since "t" is yellow, it is in the word but not in the correct position. I will also try to use common letters that often appear with "o".
guess: optic

attempts = 3
target_word = month
guess = optic
guess_feedback = o<yellow> p<red> t<yellow> i<red> c<red>

guess_feedback: o<yellow> p<red> t<yellow> i<red> c<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: I will keep "o" and try to find a new position for it, and also keep "t" as it is yellow in the previous feedback. I will change the other letters to find a better fit.
guess: toast

attempts = 4
target_word = month
guess = toast
guess_feedback = t<yellow> o<green> a<red> s<red> t<red>

guess_feedback: t<yellow> o<green> a<red> s<red> t<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since "o" is green again, it seems to be in a fixed position. I will keep "o" and try to use "t" in a different position, as it was yellow earlier. I will also try a common combination with "o".
guess: motor

attempts = 5
target_word = month
guess = motor
guess_feedback = m<green> o<green> t<yellow> o<red> r<red>

guess_feedback: m<green> o<green> t<yellow> o<red> r<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: With "m" and "o" being green, and "t" being yellow, I will try to find a word that includes these letters. Since "o" appears twice in the feedback, I will focus on getting the correct position for "m", "o", and "t".
guess: motto 

 However I changed it 
explanation: changed 
guess: motor

Guess does not conform to the format rules
Error: The response should contain only the 'guess:' and 'explanation:' keywords and associated information.

guess_explanation: I am starting with a common five-letter English word that has a good balance of vowels and consonants.

Since "h" is yellow, it is in the word but not in the correct position. "o" is green, so it is in the correct position. I will try to build on this by keeping "o" and experimenting with other letters.

I will keep "o" in the same position and try to find a new combination. Since "t" is yellow, it is in the word but not in the correct position. I will also try to use common letters that often appear with "o".
I will keep "o" and try to find a new position for it, and also keep "t" as it is yellow in the previous feedback. I will change the other letters to find a better fit.
Since "o" is green again, it seems to be in a fixed position. I will keep "o" and try to use "t" in a different position, as it was yellow earlier. I will also try a common combination with "o".
